title: Atomic Resolution Secondary Electron Imaging of Top and Bottom Surfaces
content: Secondary electron (SE) imaging offers surface sensitivity which is complementary to the projected view provided by most scanning transmission electron microscope (STEM) techniques. Atomic resolution SE images of the beam entrance surface have been demonstrated [1-3], including images of monolayer samples [4, 5]. In this work we introduce a Nion HERMES aberration corrected (AC) STEM with identical SE detectors below and above the specimen., opening the possibility of imaging the entrance and exit surfaces of transmissive samples simultaneously with other STEM data channels.
